content:
In the FlexCard Designer, you can get data from various data sources and view the data JSON returned. Configure your FlexCard's datasource from the Setup panel in the Designer. Get data directly from a Salesforce database with Omnistudio Data Mappers, SOQL Query, and SOSL Search. Get data from external sources with Rest Web. For complex business processes, get data with Apex Remote and Integration Procedures.

View the returned data from the Setup panel by clicking Save & Fetch, or in the Data JSON panel in Preview. Display data with multiple elements such as a Datatable, Chart, Image, Field, child FlexCard, and Custom LWC. Enable FlexCard element properties to access data JSON using merge fields.

A merge field is a variable that references the value of a JSON node. Configure a data source on a FlexCard to retrieve data from a Salesforce object or an external database. A Child FlexCard can have a data source independent of the parent FlexCard or use the data source from the parent FlexCard.

Enable Tracking on a FlexCard, View a FlexCard at Different Viewport Breakpoints, Activate a FlexCard, Download a FlexCard LWC, Add Custom Labels to Supported Fields on a FlexCard. Pass Data from an LWC OmniScript to an Embedded FlexCard. Reload a FlexCard After Updating an LWC OmniScript in a Flyout. Access the ContextId of a FlexCard on an Experience Site.
title: FlexCard Designer and Data Management
